content.description: This is fun, well-protected, and has a neat crux. I wish it had a name.
content.protection:
Mixed bolts and gear. It shares anchors with

5.9 #2

.
content.location:
On the

Lower Wall

, it is the furthest route to the right.

content.description: Work the flake up until it ends. Trend left, and meander up the face to the anchors.
content.protection:
Bolts and a standard rack. This shares anchors with

Unknown 5.10

.
content.location:
On the

Lower Wall

, begin under a large, right-facing flake to the left of the crescent crack.

content.description: Work the large, crescent crack, then shoot straight up a face to the anchors.
content.protection: A few bolts and a standard rack.
content.location:
On the

Lower Wall,

begin at the base of a large, crescent moon-shaped crack.

content.description: This is the most difficult route in Coaldale (for now). Work the arete.
content.protection: Bolts to coldshuts. Small cams are helpful but not necessary.
content.location:
On the

Lower Wall

, this is on the right side of the main face. The route is on an obvious arete.

content.protection: A standard rack to coldshuts and a rack with extra smaller cams.
content.location:
On the

Lower Wall

, begin to the right of a large, crescent moon crack.

content.description: Begin this climb as a highball boulder problem. After clipping first high bolt, cruise up to shared anchors.
content.protection:
9 bolts to the same anchors as

Unknown 10b

.
content.location:
On the

Upper Wall

, this is the third leftmost route on the wall.

content.description: This is a long route. A 60m rope will just barely get you down, I'd bring a 70m. Follow a long crack system.
content.protection: 11 bolts to coldshuts. Use a 70m for the rappel.
content.location:
On the

Upper Wall

, this ascends a crack 20' left of a low roof.

content.description: There is nothing particularly memorable about this one.
content.location:
On the

Upper Wall

, this is the second leftmost route.

content.description:
P1. Work a difficult face to coldshuts halfway up a slab, 60', 10c.

P2. This has a similar climbing style as the first pitch, just barely easier, 60', 10b.
content.protection: Some bolts and a single rack for between them.
content.location:
Lower wall.

Far right side of wall, second route to the left of the arete.

content.description: This ascends the cracked dihedral with some face climbing.
content.location:
On the

Upper Wall

, this is the bolt line furthest to the left.

content.description: Pull a fun roof to access fun crack/face climbing. There is decent protection throughout. Bring a 70m rope or do a double rope rappel.
content.protection:
A standard rack, double up if you're new to the grade. It shares coldshuts with

Unknown 10c

. Use a 70m rope to rappel.
content.location:
On the

Upper Wall

, begin under the obvious roof about 20' off the ground.

content.description: This is a pretty fun mixed route. It is short but sweet. Your breath doesn't have to be as hard as kerosene to enjoy this one.
content.protection: A standard rack with some bolts to coldshuts.
content.location:
On the

Lower Wall

, this is the furthest route to the left. Begin on a blocky platform.

content.description:
Work a mixture of broken cracks and dihedrals. This is well-protected throughout. I am unsure if it has anchors of its own or shares with

Two Pitch 10c

. If you have the gear, sew it up!
content.protection: This is a long route. You could get away with single rack, but that would be runout. Double up, and bring a 70m rope.
content.location:
On the

Lower Wall

, this is on the far right ride of the wall to the right of the arete.

content.description: Don't split for Ohio, get on this route!
content.location:
On the

Lower Wall

, this is the second leftmost route. Begin to the right of a large boulder.

content.description:
Climb blocky moves to face climbing to easier crimpy stuff. This is probably the best route on Upper Cottonwood. Save a #1 for one of the last moves up top!

The anchors are about 2/3s the way up the wall.
content.protection: 7 bolts and a standard rack (doubles in big fingers-small hands-sized cams are recommended).
content.location:
On the

Upper Wall

, this is the furthest route to the right. Begin to the right of obvious room on some dark blocks.

content.description: Meander up some reddish rock between 2 crack systems.
content.location:
On the

Lower Wall

, this is on the far right side of wall 15' to the right of

Two Pitch 10c

.

content.description: This is a straightforward climb up to shared anchors. Climb the reddish rock up decent holds.
content.protection:
Mixed bolts and gear. It shares anchors with

Unknown 8

.
content.location:
On the

Lower Wall

, this is on the far right side of the lower wall. It is the second to last route to the right.
